br.br:
GRADUATION
CLASS OF 2020 GRADUATION WILL BE MAY 31, 2020. YOU WILL BE RECEIVING FURTHER INFORMATION FROM PRINCIPAL SHILK.
----------------------------------------------------------------
HIRING FOR THE 2020-2021 SCHOOL YEAR
BOYS JUNIOR HIGH AND
JUNIOR VARSITY BOYS BASKETBALL HEAD COACHES
If interested please submit your letter of interest to Patsy Younkin via email pyounkin@turkeyfoot.k12.pa.us or mail to
172 Turkeyfoot Road, Confluence, PA 15424
EOE and drug testing must be done upon hiring.
----------------------------------------------------------------
BOARD MEETING
Any member of the public who wishes to submit questions or public comments for the regular board meeting of the Turkeyfoot Valley Area School District can send an email to Mrs. Dice, (ndice@turkeyfoot.k12.pa.us).
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
KINDERGARTEN REGISTRATION
Kindergarten and K-4 registration will be held on May 11, 2020. Contact Shannon Meyers for documents to be dropped off. Her number is 814.395.3621 x 251
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
TVASD CONTINUITY OF EDUCATION PLAN

Click Here to view: Continuity of Education Plan
The plan will be revised throughout implementation to fit the needs of the students and staff.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

strong.span:
Just in... Last years yearbook staff won the National Yearbook Program of Excellence Award in recognition of their outstanding Performance by the yearbook advisor, Mrs. Kathi Smith and the 2018-2019 staff pictured below. Congratulations!!!!!
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
SCHOOL CLOSURE - LATEST UPDATES

span.style: background-position: 0% 0%; font-size: 13.5pt; background-image: none; background-attachment: scroll; background-repeat: repeat; background-size: auto; background-origin: padding-box; background-clip: border-box;
span.strong: Per Gov. Wolfs' order, schools will remained closed for the remainder of the current school year. Students will not be returning to school this year. The building and grounds are closed but, we will continue with our continuity of education plan for the remainder of this school year.

span.br:
District Update 3/17/20 @ 1:53 PM
please click on link below for education update plan for Turkeyfoot
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
COVID-19 Resource Links
posted 3/16/2020
Family Resource Handwashing
/UserFiles/Servers/Server_637113/File/Staff Resources/FAMILY RESOURCE_handwashing-508_3.6.2020.pdf
Family Resouce Handwashing Spanish Version

School Meal Program during the closure:
The school will be providing meals to all students beginning on Monday March 16th and will continue through out the school closure. All meals are "to go" and may be picked up between 11:00 am and 2:00 pm on MONDAY AND THURSDAY. Students will receive several meals at each pick up. Please use the entrance in the back of the school to enter the cafeteria for pick up.

p.span:
The mission of the Turkeyfoot Valley Area School District is to afford each student an opportunity to develop both the ability to acquire broad-based knowledge in reading, writing and mathematics enabling the student to make intelligent, appropriate educational and career decisions; and also to provide each student with the skills necessary to become productive contributors in their community and environment.
Turkeyfoot Valley Area School District Vision
We believe that each child is a unique person with an individual growth pattern of development. It is our vision in the realm of curriculum and instruction that we must be responsive to individual differences in ability and interest to help students maximize their potential. To ensure opportunities for success, levels of ability, readiness, and learning styles will be recognized, accepted and integrated as teachers implement district curriculum requirements for all students. It is our vision that specific areas of emphasis should not only include needed basic skills and the ability to acquire knowledge, but challenge students to achieve at higher levels, applying learned problem solving strategies.
